column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Recover a Clothing Store
#Text=After a busy day in a clothing store or department , do n't just walk out , recover the store !
#Text=When doing this , think of how you would like your store to look if you were the customer and you 'll have plenty of motivation .
#Text=Get started at step one below .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Start with the fitting rooms .
#Text=To ensure that the fitting rooms are in a good state , you 'll need to deal with the following :
#Text=Take out all of the go backs .
#Text=Throw away all the trash left behind by customers .
#Text=Spray and wipe down the mirrors .
#Text=Take any lost property to the lost and found area .
#Text=If there is identifying information , make that clear .
#Text=Deal with the go backs .

#Text=The items that customers tried on and changed their minds about , the items they carried around the store but then dumped in the wrong section , the non-purchased goods left at the cash register and any other items that customers have removed from their original spot will all need to go back to where they belong .
#Text=To do this :
#Text=Keep all go backs at the cash wrap or assign a special shelf or rack to place them on .
#Text=Do a sweep of the store or your section of the store to find misplaced stock .
#Text=Put clothing go backs on appropriate hanger or fold them them place them where they belong .
#Text=Bring all damaged clothing and items to the break/stockroom .
#Text=Look for anything else out of place and put them in the correct location .
#Text=Tidy up the sales floor .
#Text=To make it easier for the cleaners and to ensure that the next day starts neatly , you 'll need to do the following :
#Text=Walk the floor .
#Text=Clean up all racks and re-hang , size and color code the clothes .
#Text=Make sure everything is properly hung and facing the right way .
#Text=If there are tables for clothing , fold the clothes neatly and stack them biggest to smallest size .
#Text=Make sure that the tables look nice and neat ,
#Text=Keep accessories in the appropriate location ( for example , keep the matching purses and wallets next to each other ) .
#Text=Tidy up display areas and any boxes and other items that are stacked anywhere .
#Text=Pick up things that have fallen off or have been dropped off shelves .
#Text=Do your daily housekeeping .
#Text=This will depend on whether you have cleaners coming in or you are responsible , so pick and choose from this list :
#Text=Sweep all around the floors , fitting rooms , behind the cash registers and bathrooms .
#Text=Wet mop the floors .
#Text=Then dry mop .
#Text=Spray down counters and wipe them clean .
#Text=Wipe down mirrors and windows .
#Text=Dust all fixtures .
#Text=Gather trash and replace trash bags .
#Text=Clean cash register counters .
#Text=Make sure that the registers are already counted and locked to prevent anything getting lost ) .
#Text=Clean the toilets and bathrooms , if relevant .
#Text=Spray room freshener through the store .
#Text=Deal with the cash counter .
#Text=Lock drawers and put away the money according to your store 's policy .
#Text=Wipe down computer screens .
#Text=Throw away paper or notes that are unwanted .
#Text=Arrange pens , pencils , stapler etc. , neatly .
#Text=Organize receipts in a box .
#Text=Stack all necessary papers .
#Text=Mop the floor behind the cash counter .
#Text=Wipe down the counters .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If possible , assign one to two associates to each " zone " or section of store , depending on how large your store is .
#Text=Fully walk to the floor two to three times , in order to make sure that everything looks beyond great .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Before cleaning at or near the cash wrap , make sure that the registers are locked , off and that the money has already been put away to prevent loss or damages !
